main_definition: The main definition of 'volume' is the amount of space that a substance or object occupies, usually in three dimensions.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In audio and sound recording, volume refers to the perceived loudness or intensity of the sound being played back.
meanings_and_examples.example: Please turn up the volume on your stereo; it's too quiet.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Volume in printing refers to the amount of text contained within a single page, typically measured by lines and words per page.
meanings_and_examples.example: This book has an average print volume of 350 lines per page.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In mathematics or physics, volume describes the space occupied by a three-dimensional object or region in space.
meanings_and_examples.example: The volume of this cube is calculated as length times width times height (12cm x 6cm x 4cm = 288 cubic centimeters).

meanings_and_examples.definition: In music, a musical collection or compilation that has been arranged and published in multiple volumes.
meanings_and_examples.example: This symphony is contained within three different volumes of the composer's works.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The total amount of liquid a container can hold; often used for measuring capacity in cooking or baking.
meanings_and_examples.example: A standard milk jug typically has a volume of 1 liter (or one quart).
